frame.name: Attack
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assailant</fen> physically attacks a <fen>Victim</fen> (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the <fen>Victim</fen> physical damage. A <fen>Weapon</fen> used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual <fen>Place</fen>, <fen>Time</fen>, <fen>Purpose</fen>, <fen>Explanation</fen>, etc. Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the <fen>Assailant</fen> or the <fen>Victim</fen>, and in such cases the <fen>Place</fen> FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.
<ex><fex name="Time">As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> <fex name="Victim">he</fex> was <t>set</t> <fex name="Victim">upon</fex> <fex name="Assailant">by four men in ski-masks</fex>.</ex> <ex>Is <fex name="Asl">he</fex> <t>invading</t> <fex name="Victim">Iraq</fex> <fex name="Purp">just to cover other shortcomings</fex>?</ex> <ex><fex name="Time">Then</fex> <fex name="Assailant">Jon-O's forces</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">them</fex> <fex name="Place">on the left flank</fex> <fex name="Source">from a line of low hills</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack. <ex>The mysterious fighter <t>attacked</t> <fex name="Victim">the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> to cause damage to the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>The mysterious fighter <t>attacked</t> the guardsmen <fex name="Weapon">with a sabre</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Assailant
FE.definition: <def-root>The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Assailant">The mysterious fighter</fex> <t>attacked</t> the guardsmen with a sabre.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Assailant</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> that accomplishes the assault. <ex><fex name="Assailant">Japanese</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">Americans</fex> <fex name="Means">by bombing Pearl Harbor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Time">Then</fex> <fex name="Assailant">Jon-O's forces</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">them</fex> <fex name="Place">on the left flank</fex> <fex name="Source">from a line of low hills</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>John <t>assaulted</t> Thibault <fex name="Purpose">to prove his manhood</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Assailant</fen> is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Assailant">Gloria</fex> <t>attacked</t> <fex name="Victim">Michael</fex> <fex name="Exp">for the cause of Justice</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Time">As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> <fex name="Victim">he</fex> was <t>set</t> <fex name="Victim">upon</fex> <fex name="Assailant">by four men in ski-masks</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Assailant</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Victim</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen> while the attack occurs. <ex>They <t>attacked</t> us <fex name="Depictive">in large numbers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the attack on the <fen>Victim</fen> by the <fen>Assailant</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Assailant</fen> travels. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number (or description of the number) of times an attack takes place over a period of time.
<ex>They <t>attack</t> daily.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of time that the attack lasts.
<ex>The <fex name="dur">day-long</fex> <t>attack</t> crushed our morale.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the goal of motion nor a landmark along the way.
<ex>They will no doubt launch an <t>attack</t> <fex name="Direction">towards the weakest area of our territory.</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: hinderlaag.n
lexUnit.definition: waar je je verstopt om iemand aan te vallen als hij of zij het niet verwacht
